intro: Anomocarpus eryngioides, commonly known as the needlepoint burr, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed burr that can persist on the plant for several years. Anomocarpus eryngioides is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
